title: Week 1 Reflections
text: I soldered surface mount and through hole components on the MicroPs development board. To test the board, I flashed simple programs on the FPGA and MCU to establish viewable communication between the two.

title: Week 1 Reflections
text: I soldered surface mount and through hole components on the MicroPs development board. To test the board, I flashed simple programs on the FPGA and MCU to establish viewable communication between the two.

title: Week 1 Reflections
text:
Reflections
Soldering surface mounted parts provided me with a new challenge that was quite exciting and frustrating simultaneously. I enjoyed Radiant’s intuitive FPGA design flow process compared to other IDE synthesizers like Xilinx Vivado.

title: E155 Portfolio
text: Hi, my name is Troy Kaufman and I’m a junior at Harvey Mudd College. I’m a general engineering major with an interest in digital design and computer architecture. As an intern with The Aerospace Corporation this past summer, I worked on facilitating communication between an FPGA and SPI NOR flash memory. Additionally, I designed an FPGA subsystem that monitored and replied to a proprietary satellite interface. My hobbies include playing disc golf, scripted wrestling, and building weird devices with my friends.
